job_title: Clinical Practice Manager in Dallas, TX
pros:
Great leadership 
Great autonomy 
Excellent benefits 
Good salary
cons:
Lots of time required 
Long shifts

review_title: Avoid unless you like high school all over again
pros: A lot of the everyday staff, not management, are great people with a mission to save lives Patti was a good leader Nothing else
cons: Current CEO & C-Suite are going to destroy what Patti built Silos instead of collaboration No one wants to help anyone because you might get promoted sooner or be the manager's favorite No benefits other than free coffee just like everywhere else Leadership cares more about being popular than saving lives Tries to run as a for profit business Issues brought up are ignored especially if the person is a member of leadership or a 'good' friend It is like High School without the pep rally's, cliques everywhere

pros: The mission is the only reason employees stay.
cons: The CEO is a terrible, dishonest leader. Ruined the legacy of what the former CEO built. Plays favoritism and completely self absorbed

job_title: Organ Recovery Coordinator in Dallas, TX
pros: The clinical side of things was great. Fair amount of autonomy for an ex ICU nurse
cons: The micromanaging in every other aspect of the job sucks. Dealing with transplant surgeons around the country with the biggest egos is also a challenge. Very tough job

I am a current employee, trying to find my way out of this disastrous company. Do not come to work for this company. The only way to advance is if you know someone at the top. The “C- Level” execs all have their own agendas. There is so much in-fighting between departments and individuals employees. The C suite doesn’t think that employees are leaving because of their compensation levels..they are totally out of touch..if you want a lot of drama- this is your place.

job_title: Tissue Recovery Technician II in Dallas, TX
cons: Work/ life integration. This job will work you until you are falling asleep standing up

pros: Great mission. Great co-workers. Great benefits.
cons: Hours and travel do not match compensation.

job_title: Organ Recovery Coordinator in Dallas, TX
pros: Smaller organization compared to hospital life. Management cares about employees. The mission of the organization is nice to be a part of.
cons: Hours can be very long - 24+ hour shifts not including travel across the state, day and night shift, meetings, trainings. It's a lot. The mission of the organization supercedes employee morale. Work life balance can be hard to achieve especially for clinical staff. High turnover. Pay doesn't stack up to the amount of work required.

job_title: Organ Recovery Coordinator in Dallas, TX
pros: Pay, benefits, overall mission, clinical expertise and autonomy, some really awesome people. It is a great job if you can handle the cons.
cons: A competitive CEO that has lost focus of satisfied employees. A HR department too worried about the "Culture of Joy" crap and will cater to anything except hard work, determination, and good people. A COO who doesn't know anything about organ donation and how hard it is to form bonds with hospital staff to make STAs mission successful. The organization losing good people because they try too much change too fast. The backstabbing, lies, and poor work ethic that is tolerated or acceptable without consequences. Especially an individual whom has been suspended multiple times, but keeps being repositioned and not terminated.

pros: Benefits, some really passionate and smart people, opportunity to learn a lot
cons: Hire toxic leaders, get a toxic workplace it's that simple. Turnover is so high because it's normal to use the mission to make people feel obligated to work harder, longer and accept abuse in the name of saving lives. HR is a joke. Everyone is treated as replaceable and your ungrateful if you complain. It's sad. It didn't used to be like this.

pros: The culture of care from the top down! My team cares about one another and we always celebrate our wins! It is easy to love the mission and feel like why you do each and every day matters!
cons: Can’t think of any to mention.

pros: Amazing culture and support when wanting to advance in your career
cons: Very low pay and hard to discuss with senior leadership
None that I can think of

pros:
It truly is a family.  From Mr.s Niles to the housekeeping staff. I was lucky enough to work there for 15 years. I can't say enough good things about it, The office staff are very supportive to the clinical staff and the respect goes both ways. 
The job itself (clinical) is a lifestyle and it's not for everyone. Those that stay in  it, it is the best job ever. The VP of clinical services has his finger on the pulse of his people. Chad Ezell is the best boss one can ask for. From the senior leadership, you get positive energy. They understand how tough the job can be and they do their best to help their people get over the rough patches with success being the goal.. Positive attitude, positive work environment, positive feedback, and a leadership group the really understands  the trials and tribulations associated with this industry.  The environment that is created from HR to accounting is one of confidence and support.
cons:
The hours can indeed get long but, take a step back and look at the mission and they don't seem near as long. 
I really can't say a negative thing about it. I loved my time there!

review_title: The Sales Pitch given to work for them was good.
pros: Helping a family in their greatest time of need is very satisfying and rewarding.  Learning new things is excellent and fulfilling.
cons: Communication with workers that are not in the office is awful.  Telling employees that a position is permanent when really you are just testing the waters on an idea really isn't fair to employees.  We accepted your positions (employment) with the idea from you that it was a real job....not something you would change your mind about.   This is misrepresentation in it's true form.

job_title: Organ Recovery Coordinator in Dallas, TX
pros: STA values their staff!  I have personally experienced as well as seen the company accommodate to scheduling and location based on dedicated employees needs.  This company is very team driven and everyone who works here has the same passion for saving lives.
cons: This job is not for everyone.  Its a place you either love or just don't.  It's a lot of hard work, long hours at times but if it is right for you non of that will matter.

review_title: Progressive healthcare company with a great work environment!
pros: Competitive pay, good benefits & company culture. Changes in management in the past few years, has made a lasting impact on the company culture! Managements goal is to recognize and build-up employees.
cons: Small company with limited room for growth. However, this is beginning to change.

review_title: A sound company in a challenging industry
job_title: Tissue Recovery Technician in Dallas, TX
pros: Great benefits package, quick response from upper management when morale is sinking, well-defined yet flexible long-term company vision, satisfaction of knowing your work is for a good cause.
cons: Pressure to work unreasonable hours even when there are sufficient staff to avoid this.

job_title: Family Service Coordinator in Dallas, TX
pros: Great colleagues, great mission. Peers are helpful and the team works well together ... looking out for each other.
cons: No work-life balance, management does not care about the line staff.
